quiz.question: What is the basic idea behind Linear Search?
options: Divide the array in half and search recursively
Compare each element of the array sequentially with the target
Use a pivot to partition the array for searching
Use hashing to find the element in constant time
quiz.answer: Compare each element of the array sequentially with the target

quiz.question: What is the time complexity of Linear Search in the worst case?
Is Linear Search efficient for large, sorted datasets?
What happens if the element is not found in the array?
options: The algorithm returns the index of the first element
The algorithm returns -1 or an indication of not found
quiz.answer: The algorithm returns -1 or an indication of not found

quiz.question: Which data structure is Linear Search applicable to?
options: Any list or collection that can be traversed sequentially
quiz.answer: Any list or collection that can be traversed sequentially
